pulltitle: chore(deps): update dependency google_api_python_client to v1.7.7
pullsbody:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|
| google_api_python_client | minor | `==1.6.1` -> `==1.7.7` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>google/google-api-python-client</summary>

### [`v1.7.7`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.7)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.6...v1.7.7)

##### Bugfix release

-   Change xrange to range ([#​601](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/pull/601))
-   Typo in http.py exception message. ([#​602](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/pull/602))

-   Announce deprecation of Python 2.7 ([#​603](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/pull/603))
-   Updates documentation for stopping channel subscriptions ([#​598](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/pull/598))
-   Adding example for searchAppearance ([#​414](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/pull/414))

-   Add badges ([#​455](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/pull/455))

### [`v1.7.6`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.6)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.5...v1.7.6)

Bugfix release

-   Add client-side limit for batch requests ([#​585](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/585))

### [`v1.7.5`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.5)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.4...v1.7.5)

Bugfix release

-   Fix the client to respect the passed in developerKey and credentials

### [`v1.7.4`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.4)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.3...v1.7.4)

Bugfix release

-   Catch ServerNotFoundError to retry the request ([#​532](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/532))

### [`v1.7.3`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.3)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.2...v1.7.3)

Bugfix release

-   Remove unnecessary check in apiclient/**ini**.py ([#​522](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/522)).

### [`v1.7.2`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.2)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.1...v1.7.2)

Bugfix release

-   Remove unnecessary check in apiclient/**ini**.py ([#​522](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/522)).

### [`v1.7.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.1)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.0...v1.7.1)

Bugfix release

-   Remove unnecessary check in setup.py ([#​518](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/518)).

### [`v1.7.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.7...v1.7.0)

This release drops the hard requirement on oauth2client and installs
  google-auth by default instead. oauth2client is still supported but will
  need to be explicitly installed.

-   Drop oauth2client dependency ([#​499](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/499))
-   Include tests in source distribution ([#​514](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/514))

### [`v1.6.7`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.7)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.6...v1.6.7)

Bugfix release

  **Note**: The next release of this library will no longer directly depend on
    oauth2client. If you need to use oauth2client, you'll need to explicitly
    install it.

-   Make body optional for requests with no parameters. ([#​446](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/446))
-   Fix retying on socket.timeout. ([#​495](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/495))
-   Match travis matrix with tox testenv. ([#​498](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/498))
-   Remove oauth2client.\_helpers dependency. ([#​493](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/493))
-   Remove unused keyring test dependency. ([#​496](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/496))
-   discovery.py: remove unused oauth2client import. ([#​492](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/492))
-   Update README to reference GCP API client libraries. ([#​490](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/490))

### [`v1.6.6`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.6)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.5...v1.6.6)

Bugfix release

-   Warn when constructing BatchHttpRequest using the legacy batch URI ([#​488](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/488))
-   Increase the default media chunksize to 100MB. ([#​482](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/482))
-   Remove unnecessary parsing of mime headers in HttpRequest.**init** ([#​467](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/467))

### [`v1.6.5`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.5)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.4...v1.6.5)

Bugfix release

-   Proactively refresh credentials when applying and treat a missing
    `access_token` as invalid. Note: This change reveals surprising behavior
    between default credentials and batches. If you allow
    `googleapiclient.discovery.build` to use default credentials _and_ specify
    different credentials by providing `batch.execut()` with an explicit `http`
    argument, your individual requests will use the default credentials and
    _not_ the credentials specified to the batch http. To avoid this, tell
    `build` explicitly not to use default credentials by specifying
    `build(..., http=httplib2.Http()`. ([#​469](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/469))
-   Remove mutual exclusivity check for developerKey and credentials ([#​465](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/465))
-   Handle unknown media length. ([#​406](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/406))
-   Handle variant error format gracefully. ([#​459](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/459))
-   Avoid testing against Django >= 2.0.0 on Python 2. ([#​460](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/460))

### [`v1.6.4`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.4)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.3...v1.6.4)

Bugfix release

-   Warn when google-auth credentials are used but google-auth-httplib2 isn't available. ([#​443](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/443))

### [`v1.6.3`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.3)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.2...v1.6.3)

Version 1.6.3

  Bugfix release

-   Add notification of maintenance mode to README. ([#​410](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/410))
-   Fix generation of methods with abnormal page token conventions. ([#​338](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/338))
-   Raise ValueError is credentials and developerKey are both specified. ([#​358](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/358))
-   Re-generate documentation. ([#​364](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/364), [#​373](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/373), [#​401](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/401))
-   Fix method signature documentation for multiline required parameters. ([#​374](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/374))
-   Fix ZeroDivisionError in MediaDownloadProgress.progress. ([#​377](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/377))
-   Fix dead link to WebTest in README. ([#​378](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/378))
-   Fix details missing in googleapiclient.errors.HttpError. ([#​412](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/412))
-   Don't treat httplib2.Credentials as oauth credentials. ([#​425](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/425))
-   Various fixes to the Django sample. ([#​413](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/413))

### [`v1.6.2`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.2)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.1...v1.6.2)

Version 1.6.2

  Bugfix release

-   Fixed a bug where application default credentials would still be used even
    when a developerKey was specified. ([#​347](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/347))
-   Official support for Python 3.5 and 3.6. ([#​341](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/341))

</details>

pulltitle: Fix the concept of "admin" in aws iam tests
pullsbody:
Originally, a user was an "admin" if they had a policy that included the
word "admin" in it. That kinda worked sometimes, but needed to be
replaced.

Now, in the config file you can list the admin policies and groups and a
user or role will be matched against these lists.

This PR also updates the `config.yaml` example in the README.
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Fix the concept of "admin" in aws iam tests

Originally, a user was an "admin" if they had a policy that included the
word "admin" in it. That kinda worked sometimes, but needed to be
replaced.

Now, in the config file you can list the admin policies and groups and a
user or role will be matched against these lists.

pullsbody:
Adds a test that will check that all running EC2 instances are using an
AMI in the "required_amis" list within the provided config file. If no AMIs
exist in this list, skip all of the tests.

r? @psiinon @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Add test_ec2_instance_running_required_amis test

Adds a test that will check that all running EC2 instances are using an
AMI in the "required_amis" list within the config file. If no AMIs exist
in this list, skip all of the tests.

pulltitle: chore(deps): update dependency pytest-cov to v2.6.0 - autoclosed
pullsbody:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|
| pytest-cov | minor | `==2.5.1` -> `==2.6.0` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/pytest-dev/pytest-cov) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>pytest-dev/pytest-cov</summary>

### [`v2.6.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst#​260-2018-09-03)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/compare/v2.5.1...v2.6.0)

-   Dropped support for Python < 3.4, Pytest < 3.5 and Coverage < 4.4.
-   Fixed some documentation formatting. Contributed by Jean Jordaan and Julian.
-   Added an example with `addopts` in documentation. Contributed by Samuel Giffard in
    `#​195 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/pull/195>`\_.
-   Fixed `TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable` in certain xdist configurations. Contributed by Jeremy Bowman in
    `#​213 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/pull/213>`\_.
-   Added a `no_cover` marker and fixture. Fixes
    `#​78 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/78>`\_.
-   Fixed broken `no_cover` check when running doctests. Contributed by Terence Honles in
    `#​200 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/pull/200>`\_.
-   Fixed various issues with path normalization in reports (when combining coverage data from parallel mode). Fixes
    `#​130 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/161>`_.
    Contributed by Ryan Hiebert & Ionel Cristian Mărieș in
    `#​178 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/pull/178>`_.
-   Report generation failures don't raise exceptions anymore. A warning will be logged instead. Fixes
    `#​161 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/161>`\_.
-   Fixed multiprocessing issue on Windows (empty env vars are not passed). Fixes
    `#​165 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/165>`\_.

</details>

---

### [`v1.12.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/boto/botocore/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst#​1120)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/boto/botocore/compare/1.11.9...1.12.0)

======

-   api-change:`logs`: Update logs client to latest version
-   api-change:`config`: Update config client to latest version
-   feature:Events: This migrates the event system to using sevice ids instead of either client name or endpoint prefix. This prevents issues that might arise when a service changes their endpoint prefix, also fixes a long-standing bug where you could not register an event to a particular service if it happened to share its endpoint prefix with another service (e.g. `autoscaling` and `application-autoscaling` both use the endpoint prefix `autoscaling`). Please see the `upgrade notes <https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/index.html#upgrade-notes>`\_ to determine if you are impacted and how to proceed if you are.

pulltitle: chore(deps): update dependency google_api_python_client to v1.7.4 - autoclosed
pullsbody:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|
| google_api_python_client | minor | `==1.6.1` -> `==1.7.4` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>google/google-api-python-client</summary>

### [`v1.7.4`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.4)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.3...v1.7.4)

Bugfix release

-   Catch ServerNotFoundError to retry the request ([#​532](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/532))

### [`v1.7.3`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.3)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.2...v1.7.3)

Bugfix release

-   Remove unnecessary check in apiclient/**ini**.py ([#​522](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/522)).

### [`v1.7.2`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.2)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.1...v1.7.2)

Bugfix release

-   Remove unnecessary check in apiclient/**ini**.py ([#​522](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/522)).

### [`v1.7.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.1)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.7.0...v1.7.1)

Bugfix release

-   Remove unnecessary check in setup.py ([#​518](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/518)).

### [`v1.7.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.7.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.7...v1.7.0)

This release drops the hard requirement on oauth2client and installs
  google-auth by default instead. oauth2client is still supported but will
  need to be explicitly installed.

-   Drop oauth2client dependency ([#​499](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/499))
-   Include tests in source distribution ([#​514](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/514))

### [`v1.6.7`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.7)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.6...v1.6.7)

Bugfix release

  **Note**: The next release of this library will no longer directly depend on
    oauth2client. If you need to use oauth2client, you'll need to explicitly
    install it.

-   Make body optional for requests with no parameters. ([#​446](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/446))
-   Fix retying on socket.timeout. ([#​495](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/495))
-   Match travis matrix with tox testenv. ([#​498](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/498))
-   Remove oauth2client.\_helpers dependency. ([#​493](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/493))
-   Remove unused keyring test dependency. ([#​496](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/496))
-   discovery.py: remove unused oauth2client import. ([#​492](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/492))
-   Update README to reference GCP API client libraries. ([#​490](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/490))

### [`v1.6.6`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.6)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.5...v1.6.6)

Bugfix release

-   Warn when constructing BatchHttpRequest using the legacy batch URI ([#​488](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/488))
-   Increase the default media chunksize to 100MB. ([#​482](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/482))
-   Remove unnecessary parsing of mime headers in HttpRequest.**init** ([#​467](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/467))

### [`v1.6.5`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.5)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.4...v1.6.5)

Bugfix release

-   Proactively refresh credentials when applying and treat a missing
    `access_token` as invalid. Note: This change reveals surprising behavior
    between default credentials and batches. If you allow
    `googleapiclient.discovery.build` to use default credentials _and_ specify
    different credentials by providing `batch.execut()` with an explicit `http`
    argument, your individual requests will use the default credentials and
    _not_ the credentials specified to the batch http. To avoid this, tell
    `build` explicitly not to use default credentials by specifying
    `build(..., http=httplib2.Http()`. ([#​469](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/469))
-   Remove mutual exclusivity check for developerKey and credentials ([#​465](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/465))
-   Handle unknown media length. ([#​406](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/406))
-   Handle variant error format gracefully. ([#​459](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/459))
-   Avoid testing against Django >= 2.0.0 on Python 2. ([#​460](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/460))

### [`v1.6.4`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.4)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.3...v1.6.4)

Bugfix release

-   Warn when google-auth credentials are used but google-auth-httplib2 isn't available. ([#​443](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/443))

### [`v1.6.3`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.3)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.2...v1.6.3)

Version 1.6.3

  Bugfix release

-   Add notification of maintenance mode to README. ([#​410](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/410))
-   Fix generation of methods with abnormal page token conventions. ([#​338](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/338))
-   Raise ValueError is credentials and developerKey are both specified. ([#​358](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/358))
-   Re-generate documentation. ([#​364](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/364), [#​373](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/373), [#​401](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/401))
-   Fix method signature documentation for multiline required parameters. ([#​374](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/374))
-   Fix ZeroDivisionError in MediaDownloadProgress.progress. ([#​377](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/377))
-   Fix dead link to WebTest in README. ([#​378](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/378))
-   Fix details missing in googleapiclient.errors.HttpError. ([#​412](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/412))
-   Don't treat httplib2.Credentials as oauth credentials. ([#​425](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/425))
-   Various fixes to the Django sample. ([#​413](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/413))

### [`v1.6.2`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/releases/v1.6.2)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/compare/v1.6.1...v1.6.2)

Version 1.6.2

  Bugfix release

-   Fixed a bug where application default credentials would still be used even
    when a developerKey was specified. ([#​347](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/347))
-   Official support for Python 3.5 and 3.6. ([#​341](https://renovatebot.com/gh/google/google-api-python-client/issues/341))

</details>

---

### Renovate configuration

:date: **Schedule**: At any time (no schedule defined).

:vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.

:recycle: **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or if you modify the PR title to begin with "`rebase!`".

:no_bell: **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again.

* feature:s3: Add support for S3 Select. Amazon S3 Select is an Amazon S3 feature that makes it easy to retrieve specific data from the contents of an object using simple SQL expressions without having to retrieve the entire object. With this release of the Amazon S3 SDK, S3 Select API (SelectObjectContent) is now generally available in all public regions. This release supports retrieval of a subset of data using SQL clauses, like SELECT and WHERE, from delimited text files and JSON objects in Amazon S3 through the SelectObjectContent API available in AWS S3 SDK.

* enhancement:Credentials: Add the ability to disable fetching credentials from EC2 metadata by setting the environment variable AWS_EC2_METADATA_DISABLED to 'true'.
* api-change:``config``: Update config client to latest version
* api-change:``elasticbeanstalk``: Update elasticbeanstalk client to latest version
* api-change:``glue``: Update glue client to latest version
* api-change:``medialive``: Update medialive client to latest version
* bugfix:Credentials: Fix a race condition related to assuming a role for the first time (`#​1405 <`https://github.com/boto/botocore/pull/1405`>`__)
* api-change:``events``: Update events client to latest version
* api-change:``ecs``: Update ecs client to latest version

pullsbody:
fixes: #119 

Add checks for the patterns in https://github.com/mozilla-services/pytest-services/issues/119#issuecomment-391153748

NB: This requires ripgrep which might not be installed in CI.

Functional Tests:

- [x] Add `import conftest` to a file and check that `make check_conftest_imports` errors

- [x] Add `from conftest import ` to a file and check that `make check_conftest_imports` errors

- [x] Run on master and check that `make check_conftest_imports` does not error

pull_commit_message:
Partial coverage fix

Be more explicit in import locations for operations that don't specify a
specific sub directory (like coveage)

Also add a Makefile target "clean-python" to remove all __pycache__
directories (which is needed after switching branches).

pull_commit_message:
Cleanup coverage issues

Removed (commented out) asserts that were causing issues - they were
there to debug caching, which isn't working for heroku at present.

Tweaked the Makefile cleaning rules to not require the venv for
clean-python.

by disabling the doctest portion.

This commit will show if that also fixes the issue under Travis.

pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Work around coverage report issues

Two issues:

1.  running the separate (semi-duplicate) doctest coverage yields errors
    with the new heroku/* code for unknown reasons. The extra run does
    not change the output any, per examination of prior passing travis
    runs[1].

2.  If you're a wacko who keeps multiple venvs around (for different
    python versions), the "better" approach to selecting files for the
    flake8 test is to only include python files we're going to commit.

[1] https://travis-ci.org/mozilla-services/pytest-services/builds/374026730#L792
and https://travis-ci.org/mozilla-services/pytest-services/builds/374026730#L905

pullsbody:
This includes 4 new tests that are taken from prowler's
(https://github.com/toniblyx/prowler) set of "forensics-ready" tests.

These include 3 CIS Benchmark tests (2 for Cloudtrail and 1 for VPC Flow
Logs) and an additional test for logging being enabled on
ElasticSearchService Domains.

@g-k I would love your take on the current implementation of `test_cloudtrail_enabled_in_all_regions` and `test_ec2_vpc_flow_log_enabled`. I am doing a resource fetch within the test as I don't want these tests to not run if there are no cloudtrails or vpc flow logs. What do you think?

As well, tests are not passing due to the fact that `test_cloudtrail_enabled_in_all_regions` is tested on regions and there is a hardcoded list of `['us-east-1']` for when `--offline` is passed in. Will fix once I get the :+1: / :-1: from you on the above mentioned issue.

pulltitle: Initial IAM test + refactor of GCPClient
pullsbody:
Adds the first IAM test, which tests whether service account keys
are older than 90 days. Refactored GCPClient to support IAM calls
as they function quite a bit differently from networking, compute,
and sql calls.

Also removed support for passing in multiple GCP project ids, as this is
a feature I have not found useful and makes the code a bit more complex.

r? @g-k

and sql calls.

pullsbody:
`test_iam_user_is_inactive` will fail on users considered "inactive". What is considered inactive by default is "Hasn't used the account in over a year from when the test is run" and there is a default grace period of 1 week on new accounts (since they may not have used the account at all yet). Config supports years, months, and weeks for relative "time ago".

Fixes #98

r? @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
test_iam_user_is_inactive with config support

Fixes #98

pullsbody:
`test_iam_user_is_inactive` will fail on users considered "inactive". What is considered inactive by default is "Hasn't used the account in over a year from when the test is run" and there is a default grace period of 1 week on new accounts (since they may not have used the account at all yet). Config supports years, months, and weeks for relative "time ago".

Fixes #98

pulltitle: Adds new test for cross-account roles requiring MFA
pullsbody:
Test that all IAM Roles that include admin policies and have cross account trust relationships require MFA.

As with the other "admin" tests, the way we are determining what role is an "admin" role is overly simplistic, but works as a first pass.

@g-k With this test and the other two `test_iam_admin_*` tests, I'd like to make sure it's known to any users that they are probably going to have false positives. Do you think adding a note about that to the README is enough?

r? @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.

pullsbody:
Nice to have.

The original motivation was to test things well enough to refactor the AWS client without breaking everything at some point, but this might be helpful before then (e.g. for AWS error responses).

I have more example cached responses I can clean up and some WIP tests for the client that I could push at some point. 

Changes:

* add a way to run pytest tests (e.g. to mock and test `AWS_PROFILE` env vars) against all files in addition to doctests and track combined coverage
* add an `example_cache` so we can run tests offline and in CI

Open questions/bikeshedding: 

* Is the `meta_test` prefix weird? Should meta tests go in a separate top level folder?
* Would keeping a folder cached responses make everyone sad long term?

r? @ajvb for initial feedback

TODO:

- [ ] fix flake8 failures

pulltitle: Support csv output of service report
pullsbody:
I've been using a modified version of service_report_generator.py
to generate csv's to use within spreadsheets. This includes a cleaned
up version of that code to allow for this option.

Also includes:
* adding __pytest_meta to metadata so that we can get the region of the resource.
* change to the language of 'warn' - as it's only being actively used for exemptions atm.

r? @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Support csv output of service report

I've been using a modified version of service_report_generator.py
to generate csv's to use within spreadsheets. This includes a cleaned
up version of that code to allow for this option.

Also includes adding __pytest_meta to metadata so that we can
get the region of the resource.

pulltitle: Provide error default for redshift secgroups
pullsbody:
Instead of skipping the redshift test by default,
if there is an error (most likely due to using EC2-VPC)
the resources call will return an empty list. Pytest will
display this as a `skip`, which is what we would want.

The main thing this provides is that it will support both
EC2-VPC and EC2-Classic without any code/config changes.

Fixes #66
r? @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Provide error default for redshift secgroups

Instead of skipping the redshift test by default,
if there is an error (most likely due to using EC2-VPC)
the resources call returns an empty list. Pytest will
display this as a `skip`, which is what we would want.

The main thing this provides is that it will support both
EC2-VPC and EC2-Classic without any code/config changes.

Fixes #66

pullsbody:
1. Add support for optional severity/exemptions config in
   pytest_wrapper.sh
2. Add '--continue-on-collection-errors' to ci make targets
3. Default skip redshift sec groups test
4. Remove passing in --aws-profiles for make targets
5. Fix serializing fixtures error

In regards to #4 - within our CI workflow, it is significantly
cleaner to use AWS's env var flow than create an AWS credentials
file.

In regards to #5:
Fixtures contain the boto response which has a datetime
object in it, causing "TypeError: datetime.datetime()
is not JSON serializable" errors to be thrown. Since we
are not currently using the fixtures metadata, simply
remove it

pullsbody:
This allows a user to run pytest-services as a user with MFA.

This implementation is alright, not a huge fan. The addition
of access key and secret key is caused by a conditional within
botocore's create_client method:
  https://github.com/boto/botocore/blob/develop/botocore/session.py#L838-L842

r? @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Support AWS_SESSION_TOKEN within authentication

This allows a user to run pytest-services as a user with MFA.

This implementation is alright, not a huge fan. The addition
of access key and secret key is caused by a conditional within
botocore's create_client method:
  https://github.com/boto/botocore/blob/develop/botocore/session.py#L838-L842

pulltitle: Combined service report scripts into one
pullsbody:
combined json and markdown service report scripts into one: `service_report_generator.py`

```
usage: service_report_generator.py [-h] [-jo JSON_OUT] [-mo MARKDOWN_OUT]
                                   <pytest-results.json>

positional arguments:
  <pytest-results.json>
                        Pytest results output in JSON format.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -jo JSON_OUT, --json-out JSON_OUT
                        Service json output filename.
  -mo MARKDOWN_OUT, --markdown-out MARKDOWN_OUT
                        Service markdown output filename.
```

Example:
```bash
$ python service_report_generator.py \
    --json-out service-report-2018-02-01.json \
    --markdown-out service-report-2018-02-01.md \
    results-2018-02-01.json
```

also fixes #48
 
r? @g-k
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message: Combined service report scripts into one

pullsbody:
As stated in https://github.com/mozilla-services/pytest-services/issues/27#issuecomment-361773143, we can get full coverage of RDS security groups by using `test_rds_db_security_group_does_not_grant_public_access.py` and `test_rds_db_instance_not_publicly_accessible_by_vpc_sg.py`. The one we will be missing is testing for not-currently-in-use Security Groups, which is added in #33

pullsbody:
This PR adds `service_json_to_markdown_report.py`, a script for generating a Markdown report from the output of `report_json_to_service_json.py`

Along side that, this PR includes some fixes related to making the Markdown report usable / helpful for our original use case:
- Includes a new test: `test_ec2_security_group_in_use`
- Bug fix for `aws.rds.resources.rds_db_instance_tags`
- Include EBS VolumeId in test output
- Include more metadata in service json report
- Parsing of multiple comma separated values in `--aws-regions` and `--aws-profiles`
- Small error handling fix in `report_json_to_service_json.pytest_json_to_service_json`

----

I will be creating a follow-up ticket to merge `service_json_to_markdown_report.py` and `report_json_to_service_json.py` together into one report generation CLI tool.

Fixes #30 
Related to #31

pulltitle: aws: Add ec2 instance required tag name test
pullsbody:
refs: https://github.com/mozilla-services/foxsec/issues/381

Adds a test for required EC2 instance tags.

example usage and output:

```console
pytest --ignore pagerduty/ --ignore aws/s3 --ignore aws/rds --ignore aws/iam -s --aws-profiles cloudservices-aws-stage --aws-regions us-east-1 --aws-debug-calls --aws-require-tag Name --aws-require-tag Type --aws-require-tag App --aws-require-tag Stack -k test_ec2_instance_has_required_tags
...
_____________________________________________ test_ec2_instance_has_required_tags[i-0e537fff] ______________________________________________

ec2_instance = {'AmiLaunchIndex': 0, 'Architecture': 'x86_64', 'BlockDeviceMappings': [{'DeviceName': '/dev/sda1', 'Ebs': {'AttachTim...11:53+00:00', 'DeleteOnTermination': True, 'Status': 'attached', 'VolumeId': 'vol-11d6ffff'}}], 'ClientToken': '', ...}
required_tag_names = frozenset({'App', 'Name', 'Stack', 'Type'})

    @pytest.mark.ec2
    @pytest.mark.parametrize(
        'ec2_instance',
        ec2_instances(),
        ids=ec2_instance_test_id)
    def test_ec2_instance_has_required_tags(ec2_instance, required_tag_names):
        """
        Checks that all EC2 instances have the tags with the required names.
    
        Does not not check tag values.
        """
        instance_tag_names = set(tag['Key'] for tag in ec2_instance['Tags'])
    
        # set difference to find required tags not on instance
        missing_tag_names = required_tag_names - instance_tag_names
>       assert not missing_tag_names, \
          "EC2 Instance {0[InstanceId]} missing required tags {1!r}".format(ec2_instance, missing_tag_names)
E       AssertionError: EC2 Instance i-0e537fff missing required tags frozenset({'Stack'})
E       assert not frozenset({'Stack'})

aws/ec2/test_ec2_instance_has_required_tags.py:27: AssertionError
```

r? @ajvb
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message: aws: Add ec2 instance required tag name test

pulltitle: Move RDS helpers to helpers.py + add 'make doctests'
pullsbody:
Prep work for #13 

Moving them all to `helpers.py` was to not have to deal with doctest executing pytest decorators. Would get errors around `botocore_client` being a `None type` due to not having pytest set it up. Don't really want those decorators executing anyways.

pulltitle: Encrypted EBS Volumes and Admin Users MFA tests
pullsbody:
This PR adds two tests:

- test_ec2_ebs_volume_encrypted
- test_iam_admin_user_without_mfa

We will want to eventually change `test_iam_admin_user_without_mfa` to test for all users that can log in, but for now this is a nice scoping.

### Discussion

If you look at the `user_is_admin` function, there is a comment block above it:
```
# FIXME
# Substring matching is _not_ enough of a check, but works for testing.
# The truth is that we probably shouldn't depend too much on the concept
# of an "admin" in AWS, since that's not how the ACL's really work. We
# should probably move towards concepts like "has write access", "can
# read secrets", etc.
```

Something I'd like to discuss is whether attempting to scope to the concept of an "Admin" via policies is ok for now or if this should get more flushed out at this point.
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message:
Added two new tests

1. EC2 EBS Volumes Encrypted
2. IAM User's MFA Exists

As a part of the second one, created iam/resources.py

pulltitle: Encrypted EBS Volumes and Admin Users MFA tests
pullsbody:
This PR adds two tests:

- test_ec2_ebs_volume_encrypted
- test_iam_admin_user_without_mfa

We will want to eventually change `test_iam_admin_user_without_mfa` to test for all users that can log in, but for now this is a nice scoping.

### Discussion

If you look at the `user_is_admin` function, there is a comment block above it:
```
# FIXME
# Substring matching is _not_ enough of a check, but works for testing.
# The truth is that we probably shouldn't depend too much on the concept
# of an "admin" in AWS, since that's not how the ACL's really work. We
# should probably move towards concepts like "has write access", "can
# read secrets", etc.
```

Something I'd like to discuss is whether attempting to scope to the concept of an "Admin" via policies is ok for now or if this should get more flushed out at this point.
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.

pullsbody:
This PR adds two tests:

- test_ec2_ebs_volume_encrypted
- test_iam_admin_user_without_mfa

We will want to eventually change `test_iam_admin_user_without_mfa` to test for all users that can log in, but for now this is a nice scoping.

### Discussion

If you look at the `user_is_admin` function, there is a comment block above it:
```
# FIXME
# Substring matching is _not_ enough of a check, but works for testing.
# The truth is that we probably shouldn't depend too much on the concept
# of an "admin" in AWS, since that's not how the ACL's really work. We
# should probably move towards concepts like "has write access", "can
# read secrets", etc.
```

Something I'd like to discuss is whether attempting to scope to the concept of an "Admin" via policies is ok for now or if this should get more flushed out at this point.
pull_repo_desc: Unit testing framework for test driven security of AWS, GCP, Heroku and more.
pull_commit_message: Changes 'user without mfa' to be admin-policy-specific
